title: Interrobang
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Interrobang**

A seldom-used bit of 20th-century [punctuation](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/punctuation) that combines the [question mark](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/question%20mark) and the [exclamation point](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/exclamation%20point).

Typophile threads discussing the history and usefullness of the interrobang:  
 [Chitty Chitty Interrobang Bang](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/node/908)  
 [!?: interrobang](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/node/9086)  
 [Interrobang. Eh?](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/node/9795)  
 [origins of question mark/exclamation mark/interrobang](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/node/31156)  
 [Bring back the Interrobang](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/node/34013)

More about the interrobang at the FontFeed:  
 [National Punctuation Day Reignites Interrobang Passion](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/the-interrobang-and-national-punctuation-day/)

**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Publications](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Publications) : Interrobang**

A [SOTA](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/SOTA) publication, edited by [Stephen Coles](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Stephen%20Coles) and [Tamye Riggs](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tamye%20Riggs). The magazine features writers from the type and design communities, unpublished typefaces, and more.

_Interrobang 1_  
Articles

- "Death to Helvetica" by [Nick Shinn](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Nick%20Shinn)
- "Why Joe Won't Buy" by [Stephen Coles](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Stephen%20Coles)

Unexposed

- Yakuza by [Jared Benson](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jared%20Benson)
- Plumpo by [Peter Bruhn](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Peter%20Bruhn)
- Typress by [Jacques Le Bailly](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jacques%20Le%20Bailly)
- Enterprise by [Angus Shamal](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Angus%20Shamal)
- Latinaires by [Alejandro Paul](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Alejandro%20Paul)

Colophon

- Worldwide, Preface, and Artifact by [Nick Shinn](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Nick%20Shinn)
- Plumpo by [Peter Bruhn](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Peter%20Bruhn)

_Interrobang 2_  
Articles

- "The Case for a User Friendly [EULA](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/EULA)" by [Tiffany Wardle](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tiffany%20Wardle)

_Interrobang 3_

_Interrobang 4_ Special [Dwiggins](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Dwiggins) issue 2006  
Articles

- "The Experimental Type Designs of W.A. Dwiggins" by [Tiffany Wardle](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tiffany%20Wardle)
- "The Serious Humor of Dwiggins" by [Richard Kegler](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Richard%20Kegler)
- "The Fonts of Dwiggins" by [Tiffany Wardle](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tiffany%20Wardle)
- "Comment on Electra" by [W.A. Dwiggins](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/W.A.%20Dwiggins)
- "Gallery" Dwiggins' Lettering, Design, and Marionettes
- "An Interview with Hermann Püterschein" by [Allan Haley](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Allan%20Haley)

Type designers with work featured in the magazine include [Akira Kobayashi, [[Cyrus Highsmith](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Akira%20Kobayashi%2C%20%5B%5BCyrus%20Highsmith), [Jonathan Hoefler](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jonathan%20Hoefler), [Sibylle Hagmann](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Sibylle%20Hagmann), [Tobias Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tobias%20Frere-Jones), [Jim Spiece](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jim%20Spiece), [Thomas Rickner](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Thomas%20Rickner), [David Berlow](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/David%20Berlow), [Richard Kegler](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Richard%20Kegler), [Charles Nix](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Charles%20Nix), and [Kent Lew](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Kent%20Lew)

_Interrobang 5_ 2007  
Articles

- "Tech Spotlight" the State of [OpenType](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/OpenType)
- "Neutrality in Type Design" by [Kai Bernau](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Kai%20Bernau)
- "The Ressurection of Zebra" by [Richard Kegler](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Richard%20Kegler)
- "Unexposed" Five Unpublished Typefaces
- "Art in Type Design" by [Frederic W. Goudy](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Frederic%20W.%20Goudy)
- "The Scribe and the Silhouette" by [Mark Jamra](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Mark%20Jamra)
- "A Boy and His Type (on [Christopher Stern](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Christopher%20Stern))" by [Amy REdmond](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Amy%20REdmond)
- "Happy Birthday, Helvetica"

[http://www.typesociety.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20150127045706/http:/www.typesociety.org/ "http://www.typesociety.org")
author: Conor
